授業方法: This course will be taught face-to-face. Some meetings via Zoom will be held as needed. Weekly meetings mostly consist of mini lectures, reading-based discussions, survey / interview development workshops, data analysis sessions, individual and pair / group presentations, Graduation Thesis writing workshops, and peer and instructor feedback sessions. Students will also plan, rehearse for, and present at the Research Fair in November.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 sessions are planned for face-to-face format.
The primary focus of this fourth-year seminar is the successful completion of the Graduation Thesis research project. Students will team up on selected Junior Thesis research projects. Having proposed and designed the study, students will now work together in pairs / small groups to implement the research by: 1) developing research tools (e.g., surveys, interviews, texts, etc.), 2) conducting fieldwork in order to collect data, 3) analyzing data and interpreting results, and 4) writing their Graduation Thesis. Students will report on their research progress, receive guidance on academic thesis research and writing, and give presentations on their final thesis. Students will present at the Research Fair in November and submit their Graduation Thesis by the December deadline.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Student preparation outside of class meetings includes:
(1) Weekly assignments, including carefully reading English academic journal articles and completing preparation tasks
(2) Conducting literature research for their Graduation Thesis
(3) Developing research instruments (surveys and interviews)
(4) Collecting and analyzing data
(5) Preparation for and delivery of thesis oral progress reports and formal presentations
(6) Writing, using peer and instructor feedback, and revising Graduation Thesis drafts.

Fieldwork Trip:
There will likely be a domestic fieldwork trip related to the themes of this seminar either in the 3rd or 4th year. In principle, all students will be required to join the fieldwork trip. More information will be provided during the seminar.

Study Abroad:
Students who wish to participate in KGU study abroad programs during Research Seminar I (the 3rd year) might be able to do so with the instructor's permission. It is necessary to consult with the instructor in advance. It is not possible to join such programs during Research Seminar II (the 4th year).
